definition: name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people
position/location/place/seat/classifier for people (honorific)/classifier for binary bits (e.g. 十六位 16-bit or 2 bytes)/(physics) potential

sentences.english: After honor And state, follow envy And hate.
sentences.chinese: 有了名位，嫉妒和仇恨便接踵而至。

sentences.english: It's my pleasure to be here to share with you my research findings.
sentences.chinese: 非常高兴能够到这里与名位分享我的研究结果。

sentences.english: I hope you will find your favorite units today.
sentences.chinese: 希望名位能够选购心目中最理想的单位。

sentences.english: After honor and state, follow envy and hate.
sentences.chinese: 有了名位，嫉妒和仇恨便接踵而来。

definition: an official position/a job in the bureaucracy
to confer a title/to ennoble/to knight/title of nobility
order of feudal nobility, namely: Duke 公[gong1], Marquis 侯[hou2], Count 伯[bo2], Viscount 子[zi3], Baron 男[nan2]
